definition:
If for a given prime $p$ we can find an integer $n > 0$ such that
$n! \equiv -1 \mod p$ but $p \not\equiv 1 \mod n$ then $p$ is a called a
[*Pillai prime*]{}. These are listed in A063980 of Sloane’s OEIS.
Sarinya Intaraprasert proved that there are infinitely many Pillai
primes. The first few are 23, 29, 59, 61, 67, 71, 79, 83, 109, 137, 139,
149, 193, …
